question_sentence: Taylor Swift attended which NFL match amid rumours of a new romance?
choices: Kansas City Chiefs vs. Chicago Bears
New York Jets vs. New England Patriots
evidence: Swift watched the Chiefs crush the Bears on Sunday from the private box of Chiefs player Travis Kelce, whom she is rumoured to be dating. This coming-together of "two of the biggest cultural phenomena" in the US "possibly brought in a whole new group of fans" to the NFL, said Fox News.

question_sentence: Three astronauts returned to Earth this week after how many days in space?
evidence: The crew, an American and two Russians, had prepared to spend 180 days in space, but their original return capsule was hit by space junk while docked to the International Space Station. The resulting coolant leak was only discovered about three months after the crew had left Earth, in December 2022.

question_sentence: A zero-waste restaurant in east London is reportedly serving kebabs made of what?
evidence: Silo has a menu which "might look like a list of roadkill", ITV News reported, but it is in fact is helping to tackle invasive species. Douglas McMaster, chef and owner of the restaurant, said squirrel was "delicious" and more sustainable than any supermarket fare. For more stories from the stranger side of life, subscribe to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which would-be Republican presidential nominee referred to the absent Donald Trump as "Donald Duck" during the second GOP debate?
evidence: Trump, who continues to lead the 2024 polls, skipped Wednesday's debate in California and instead delivered a speech in Michigan. The remaining candidates battled it out at the Ronald Reagan presidential library in Simi Valley, California, with former New Jersey governor calling Trump "afraid" over his absence.

question_sentence: The UK's first consumption room for illegal drugs has been given the go-ahead to open in which city?
evidence: Proposals for a "safe" consumption room, where users can take drugs under medical supervision, had been discussed for years – but now Scotland's chief public prosecutor has said that users would not be prosecuted for possession while at the facility, allowing the trial to get under way. Glasgow has long had "the worst drug death rate in Europe", said Al Jazeera.

question_sentence: Which athlete shattered the women's marathon record last Sunday in Berlin while wearing new £400 "super shoes"?
evidence: Ethiopia's Assefa crossed the line in two hours, 11 minutes and 53 seconds, knocking more than two minutes off the previous record set by Kenya's Brigid Kosgei in 2019. Only 48 hours later, Adidas put the Adizero Adios Pro Evo 1 trainers on the market – only for the stock to sell out within hours.

question_sentence: Which broadcaster suspended commentator Laurence Fox for making "totally inappropriate" comments about a female journalist?
evidence: In a live interview with host Dan Wootton, the actor and political activist said of political journalist Ava Evans: "Show me a self-respecting man who would like to climb into bed with that." Wootton has also been suspended, after Fox released a screenshot of a private conversation between the two seemingly making light of the incident.

question_sentence: The 2025 World Exposition fair venue could cost nearly double the original estimate, thanks to high inflation and labour shortages in which country?
evidence: Organisers said the price of constructing the venue, on a man-made island in Osaka Bay, has risen to ¥230 billion (£1.2 billion) – potentially putting the six-month showcase of exhibitions in jeopardy. To find out more, listen to The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Liberal Democrat party members rejected leader Ed Davey's plans to scrap which pledge?
choices: Build 380,000 new homes a year in England
Cut greenhouse gas emissions to net zero by 2045
evidence: Davey had previously said he wanted to drop the pledge in favour of local targets focused on council or social homes, but his plan was "foiled by a group of young activists" at the party's national conference in Bournemouth, said Sky News, who argued the policy was not sufficiently ambitious. The vote has been a "blow to Davey's authority", said The Guardian.

question_sentence: Brazil's president Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva warned fellow world leaders of the risk of another coup in which country?
evidence: Nearly 70 years after the Central American country's first democratically elected government was toppled, there are warnings that the son of its first democratically elected president – surprise presidential election winner Bernardo Arévalo – may be facing the same fate, with electoral officials suspending his centre-left Semilla party. For more stories from around the world, sign up to our weekly Global Digest newsletter.

question_sentence: Which major strike in the US ended this week?
evidence: The Hollywood writers’ strike is finally over after a tentative agreement was reached between union negotiators and major studios. All eyes have turned toward striking actors and autoworkers who remain on the picket lines.

question_sentence: Where did the second Republican presidential debate take place?
evidence: Wednesday night’s showdown took place at the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library in Simi Valley, California. Seven GOP contenders were on the debate stage, but former President Donald Trump — the party’s front-runner — skipped the event.

question_sentence: Which pop star sent the internet into a frenzy after making a surprise appearance at a Kansas City Chiefs football game?
evidence: Following weeks of dating speculation, Taylor Swift was seen celebrating in Travis Kelce’s family suite at the Kansas City Chiefs game on Sunday. Her surprise appearance was trending on social media and brought a 400% surge in Kelce’s jersey sales.

question_sentence: How many free Covid-19 tests can US households now order from the government?
evidence: The US government relaunched a program this week that allows US households to order up to four free tests from Covidtests.gov.

question_sentence: Which retail chain recalled nearly 50,000 mattresses due to the risk of mold exposure?
evidence: Federal safety regulators said thousands of mattresses sold exclusively at Costco could have been exposed to water during the manufacturing process, potentially leading to health risks for consumers with weakened immune systems and mold allergies.

question_sentence: What is creeping up the Mississippi River toward New Orleans that is sparking concern among officials?
evidence: A surge of saltwater is creeping up the Mississippi River toward New Orleans, threatening to pollute the drinking water of around 800,000 people.

question_sentence: Former President Donald Trump and his adult sons were found liable for fraud in which state?
evidence: A New York judge this week found former President Trump and his sons liable for fraud, saying the Trumps provided false financial statements for roughly a decade.

question_sentence: Approximately how many smartphone notifications do teenagers receive each day?
evidence: A new report suggests teens get as many as 237 or more notifications each day on their smartphones. Researchers also found teenagers often leave their notifications on even when they feel bombarded.

question_sentence: More than 3 million Hyundai and Kia vehicles are involved in a new recall due to what widespread issue?
evidence: A new recall warns millions of Hyundai and Kia vehicles could suddenly catch fire.

question_sentence: Which musician will headline the Super Bowl LVIII halftime show?
evidence: Grammy-winning R&B singer Usher will take to the field at Las Vegas’ Allegiant Stadium on February 11, 2024.

question_sentence: Which major Delaware craft brewery recently announced its closure after nearly 8½ years of operation in Smyrna?
Which Delaware diner was known for its quirky design, featuring a mock crashed plane on its roof as a roadside attraction?

Which Delaware State University alumnus, now playing for the Colorado Buffaloes, could see extra playing time in the upcoming game against USC due to his strong performance despite limited playing time in the previous game against Oregon?

Who was named the CAA’s co-defensive player of the week after his standout performance as a cornerback in Delaware's victory against New Hampshire, despite being flagged three times for pass interference during the game?
According to the J.D. Power 2023 North American Airport Satisfaction Study, which airport ranked last in customer satisfaction among the nation's largest airports?
Who was hired as the new police chief of Delaware State University?
Which organization secured $1 million from the Delaware General Assembly to purchase the historic Gibraltar mansion?
choices: The Delaware Department of Historic Preservation

question_sentence: What sparked a police investigation at Carousel Park in Pike Creek, Delaware?
What prompted felony charges this week against a Delaware State Police trooper?
What issue is currently preventing the opening of the Lidl store in Bear, Delaware?
